page.title: 09LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: People were given a questionaire about their recreation time. The results are summarized below. The most popular recreation centre was Horsham Swimming Centre followed by the Arts Centre: most leisure time was spent at home using home computers and televison. Televison is the most popular with videos becoming increasingly popular. Few people visited the cinema. People felt they had less leisure time than in the past; about two hours per day on average. Joining clubs was more popular with children than adults. Computer games have largely replaced board games in the home. Reading is popular in many forms e.g.books Ceefax, Oracle, magazines and newspapers. When asked how many books they read in a month, a popular answer was 4 from adults and 2 from children.
